alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 11:09PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN MASON, NORTHWESTERN LEWIS AND SOUTHERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1109 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Tollesboro, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Washington, Manchester, Vanceburg, Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Rome, Blue Creek, Concord, Trinity, Rectorville, Epworth, Ribolt, Charters, Cedar Mills, Sandy Springs, Mount Gilead, Carrs and Fleming-Mason Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for northern and northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
